fact_check_explanation_title: Street fight was not filmed when lockdown eased in England
fact_check_explanation_summary: A film of a brawl in a city centre street was not taken in Luton as the pubs re-opened.

fact_check_explanation_title: The government hasn’t said the vaccine will cause a third wave of deaths
fact_check_explanation_summary: Covid-19 vaccines aren’t 100% efficient, but experts aren’t predicting they will cause mass hospitalisations.

fact_check_explanation_title: Claims that a quarter of all Covid-19 deaths weren’t caused by the virus misinterpret the data
fact_check_explanation_summary: Media reports of the new figures do not make it clear that this figure only relates to one week of data.

fact_check_explanation_title: Covid-19 vaccine did not kill every animal it was tested on
fact_check_explanation_summary: A Facebook post is wrong to claim animals involved in vaccine trials died from sepsis, immune disorder or cardiac failure.

fact_check_explanation_title: Fibres from masks and swabs aren’t 'Morgellons'
fact_check_explanation_summary: Several videos on social media give false warnings about ‘Morgellons’ in face masks and Covid-19 test swabs.

fact_check_explanation_title: Facebook post makes misleading claims about Covid-19 passports and death rate
fact_check_explanation_summary: A post on Facebook makes misleading claims about Covid-19 vaccines, Covid-19 passports, infection, transmission and the death rate.

fact_check_explanation_title: The weekend Covid-19 death figures need more context
fact_check_explanation_summary: There is always a lag in reports of Covid-19 deaths over the weekend.

fact_check_explanation_title: Poverty is not the same as food insecurity
fact_check_explanation_summary: Claims about all households in poverty struggling to put food on the table need a closer look.

fact_check_explanation_title: Why you can’t compare deaths after a positive Covid-19 test with deaths after a vaccine
fact_check_explanation_summary: Deaths soon after catching Covid are usually caused by it. Deaths soon after a Covid vaccine usually are not.

fact_check_explanation_title: ‘Why would we suddenly go to them and lie?’: How councils and communities are working together to fight vaccine misinformation
fact_check_explanation_summary: For councils, increasing vaccine uptake is a matter of increasing accessibility and addressing fears by fighting misinformation. We spoke to councils across England to find out how they’re doing it.

fact_check_explanation_title: The chance of being killed by a cow and other AstraZeneca vaccine risk comparisons explained
fact_check_explanation_summary: Is it a cow? Is it a plane? The hunt for a straightforward way to explain the AstraZeneca vaccine risk is complicated.

fact_check_explanation_title: What’s a PCR test cycle threshold and why it matters
fact_check_explanation_summary: It’s been falsely claimed the WHO said PCR tests are flawed. It said “weak positive” cases with high “cycle thresholds” may need to be retested.
